title: Mentally defeated
body:
I realize when playing a game and the tide turns for the worse that I tend to defeat myself mentally before we actually lose, resulting in poor play habits and just lacklustre effort.

I don't know what it is but I feel like this isn't just me and it should be looked at because from a game perspective it is really detrimental, to me and especially my team when I'm jg and I am not responding to pings because I feel like we lost already. It really sucks to just give up when things are not going your way because you are shutting down opportunities for a really rewarding game and it results in a terrible outcome that you seethe about for days.

Does anyone else face this issue? 

If so what are some things you do to get over it? Mental strategies?

Any help is welcome ;)

replies.body: I have more of a problem people mentally screwing my team, 100% would of won if maokai didn't keep harassing my whole team over one mistake. He got to them before they could mute him. It's pretty hard to do anything with 4 people thinking along the lines of "we lost, why try." Then he blames them for feeding on top of that, he has 1 death, only because he helped in 0 fights and farmed, no ganks at all. He gave up after their adc got first blood. Then tainted the rest of my teams minds. Its people like that who cause loss. Bringing down whole team mentally because of one mistake.

I'm about to tell you things you already know and then something which may or may not help.

Wins and Losses aren't important. Seriously, do you think that anyone can remember whether they won or lost 50 games ago. You could guess, but you couldn't be 100%. Also, you aren't going to become Faker overnight (or perhaps at all but shhhh... dreams and shit), because neither did he (in a metaphorical sense, because at some point, he type Faker into a summoner naming box and then boom! Faker). Also you can't win every game. You just can't. No one can. So don't try to.

What? Don't try to win. No, that's not completely true. Of course, try to win, but don't make then end goal of every game to win. Make it about improving ONE area of your game. For example, if you are bad at last hitting then every game make the goal of being above a certain CS at a certain time rather than putting it on the win/loss. Then at the end of the game, regardless of the result, you can say either, No I didn't make it, I need to continue focusing on that or I did it! Awesome! Eventually, your whole game improves and you don't have a stress of having to win games.

Good advice for someone in level 15 but not my issue, I get into situations where I help top dominate and then find out sup is afk and enemy top was a smurf playing around with us. Who proceeds to really kick top's ass, now its not that I am not confidant in beating him but I am not confidant that the game is winnable as a whole.

I am not complaining that I lose games and getting mopey about it, I get into the mindset of "this game is over already" sometimes by 7 minutes and that is my issue.

Not some confidence nosedive because I have some easily identifiable problem that I need to work on but don't before it becomes an issue... I choose to self improve m8 all the time.

Edit: If you are going to call me a hypocrite guys about my last paragraph just think as to why I posted on the boards for help in the first place

Edit#2: it's called self sabotage

>I am not confidant that the game is winnable as a whole.

> I am not complaining that I lose games and getting mopey about it, I get into the mindset of "this game is over already" sometimes by 7 minutes and that is my issue.

My advice was to not make games about winning, but improving YOUR play and you have chosen  to completely ignore me and continued to complain, therefore you are being mopey about it and you need to get over yourself.
Sorry for my bullshit comments, I have a habit of saying shit I regret sometimes

I know what your advice was, it doesn't help because I don't need to be told to make games about self development as I already know that. I already DO that.

What I am talking about isn't a plea for confidence boosting, it is a request for help from people who may have successfully managed self sabotage in game so that it doesn't affect them and cause them to throw.

Self sabotage, not "im not winning and its my wood elo mechanics' fault"

Edit: Aside for it's irrelevance in this post, your advice on self improvement is damn good

I'd say if you mentally screw yourself when things go south that you should just take a break for a while and once you come back you should feel a bit refreshed and hopefully coming back after a break you adapt to get a bit better at not mentally sabotaging yourself. I myself ain't played for a little bit now hoping when I go back to playing I will be able to handle it a bit better and not lose my temper and get angry at others/myself.
